Sure, recursion is a programming concept in which a function calls itself repeatedly until it reaches a base case that stops the recursion. The function solves a problem by breaking it down into smaller subproblems of the same type, which are then solved by the function itself. This process continues until the solution to the base case is found. Recursion is often used in algorithms to solve problems that can be divided into smaller, more manageable parts.
